SCANDALOUS.Definition: causing public feelings of shock and anger

GAMBLING.Definition: the activity of playing games of chance for money

ARISTOCRAT.Definition: a person of high social rank

PEER.Definition: member of nobility, a person of high social rank

ADDICT.Definition: someone who couldn't stay away from a bad habit

NANNY.Definition: the person who was paid to look after his children

TERRACE.Definition: built as part of a continuous row in the same style as the other houses

BURST.Definition: entered in a hurried and sudden way

PUNTERS.Definition: the people drinking in the bar

WITNESSED.Definition: seen it the moment it was happening

FATEFUL.Definition: having an important effect on the future

PEERS.Definition: members of nobility, people of high social rank

HEREDITARY.Definition: passed down from father to son

PRIVILEGED.Definition: having a lot of special advantages

EXOTIC.Definition: unusual and exciting because of coming from far away

DASHING.Definition: attractive in a confident and stylish way

ADDICTION.Definition: something that he couldn't do without

COMPULSIVE.Definition: doing it a lot without being able to stop

BLUNTLY.Definition: in a honest and straightforward way

ELIGIBLE BACHELOR.Definition: desirable and worthy of choice potential husband

ON THE SURFACE.Definition: as it seemed, to all appearances

CUSTODY.Definition: legal right to care for them

ALLEGEDLY.Definition: according to what people say, supposedly

ESTRANGED.Definition: the one he was no longer living with

COVER.Definition: story he would use to hide the truth

BLOODSTAINED.Definition: with marks of blood in it

BOOT.Definition: the enclosed space at the back of the car, trunk

HIPPY.Definition: a person who rejects the way that most people live in Western society, often having long hair, wearing brightly coloured clothes and taking drugs

HELD TO RANSOM.Definition: kept him prisoner until money was paid

COLONY.Definition: an area controlled by a more powerful country

DRASTICALLY.Definition: in a way that is likely to have a strong or very noticeable effect
